google_dataproc_cluster.description: Manages a Cloud Dataproc cluster resource.

name.description: The name of the cluster, unique within the project and

project.description: The ID of the project in which the `cluster` will exist. If it

region.description: The region in which the cluster and associated nodes will be created in.

cluster_config.description: Allows you to configure various aspects of the cluster.

staging_bucket.description: The Cloud Storage staging bucket used to stage files,

gce_cluster_config.description: Common config settings for resources of Google Compute Engine cluster

master_config.description: The Google Compute Engine config settings for the master instances

worker_config.description: The Google Compute Engine config settings for the worker instances

preemptible_worker_config.description: The Google Compute Engine config settings for the additional (aka

software_config.description: The config settings for software inside the cluster.

security_config.description: Security related configuration. Structure defined below.

autoscaling_config.description: The autoscaling policy config associated with the cluster.

initialization_action.description: Commands to execute on each node after config is completed.

encryption_config.description: The Customer managed encryption keys settings for the cluster.

lifecycle_config.description: The settings for auto deletion cluster schedule.

zone.description: The GCP zone where your data is stored and used (i.e. where

network.description: The name or self_link of the Google Compute Engine

subnetwork.description: The name or self_link of the Google Compute Engine

service_account.description: The service account to be used by the Node VMs.

service_account_scopes.description: The set of Google API scopes

tags.description: The list of instance tags applied to instances in the cluster.

internal_ip_only.description: By default, clusters are not restricted to internal IP addresses,

metadata.description: A map of the Compute Engine metadata entries to add to all instances

num_instances.description: Specifies the number of preemptible nodes to create.

machine_type.description: The name of a Google Compute Engine machine type

min_cpu_platform.description: The name of a minimum generation of CPU family

image_uri.description: The URI for the image to use for this worker.  See [the guide](https://cloud.google.com/dataproc/docs/guides/dataproc-images)

accelerators.description: The Compute Engine accelerator configuration for these instances. Can be specified multiple times.

image_version.description: The Cloud Dataproc image version to use

override_properties.description: A list of override and additional properties (key/value pairs)

optional_components.description: The set of optional components to activate on the cluster.

policy_uri.description: The autoscaling policy used by the cluster.

script.description: The script to be executed during initialization of the cluster.

kms_key_name.description: The Cloud KMS key name to use for PD disk encryption for

idle_delete_ttl.description: The duration to keep the cluster alive while idling

auto_delete_time.description: The time when cluster will be auto-deleted.

cluster_config.0.master_config.0.instanc.description: List of master instance names which

cluster_config.0.worker_config.0.instanc.description: List of worker instance names which have been assigned

cluster_config.0.preemptible_worker_conf.description: List of preemptible instance names which have been assigned

cluster_config.0.bucket.description: The name of the cloud storage bucket ultimately used to house the staging data

cluster_config.0.software_config.0.prope.description: A list of the properties used to set the daemon config files.

cluster_config.0.lifecycle_config.0.idle.description: Time when the cluster became idle
